intro: Mecopodum parvifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mecopodum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is relatively rare and is found in specific regions of Asia.
